สติเฟล์คาดว่า Bitcoin อาจล่มสลายลงถึง 38,000 ดอลลาร์ บดบังคับให้ ETH, XRP ของ Ripple และ Cardano ต้องเผชิญภาวะวิกฤต

Bitcoin Could Collapse To $38,000, Stifel Predicts, Spelling Doom For ETH, Ripple’s XRP, Cardano

19h ago//Brenda Ngari
bitcoinethereumaltcoins
AI

Summary

TH

นักวิเคราะห์จากบริษัทจัดการความมั่งคั่ง Stifel คาดการณ์ว่าราคา Bitcoin (BTC) สามารถร่วงลงไปถึงระดับ $38,000 ในอีกไม่กี่เดือนข้างหน้า ซึ่งถือเป็นการปรับตัวลงอย่างมากจากระดับปัจจุบัน การคาดการณ์ที่มองในแง่ร้ายนี้อ้างอิงจากแนวโน้มตลาด 'super-bear' ในอดีตและนโยบายการเงินที่เข้มข้นจาก Federal Reserve Stifel ประเมินว่าอาจมีการดึงตัวกลับถึง 70% จากระดับสูงสุดตลอดกาล โดยชี้ให้เห็นว่า Bitcoin ได้ลบล้างผลกำไรที่สะสมมา 15 เดือนและเผชิญกับแรงกดดันจากการขาดกฎหมายสนับสนุน เช่น CLARITY Act ตลาดในวงกว้างได้รับผลกระทบตามไปด้วย โดย Ethereum (ETH) ร่วงลงมากกว่า 30% และ Altcoin รายใหญ่อื่นๆ เช่น XRP และ Cardano (ADA) ก็ประสบกับความสูญเสียอย่างหนัก ความล่าช้าในการผ่านกฎหมาย CLARITY Act หลังจากที่ Coinbase ถอนการสนับสนุน ได้ทำให้บรรยากาศตลาดซบเซาลงเพิ่มเติม Stifel เตือนว่าการดิ่งลงของ Bitcoin อาจกระตุ้นให้เกิดความหลีกเลี่ยงความเสี่ยง (risk aversion) อย่างกว้างขวางในภาคส่วน cryptocurrency

EN

Analysts at global wealth management firm Stifel predict that Bitcoin (BTC) could decline to as low as $38,000 in the coming months, representing a significant drop from current levels. This bearish outlook is based on historical 'super-bear' market trends and a hawkish monetary policy from the Federal Reserve. Stifel estimates a potential 70% pullback from all-time highs, noting that Bitcoin has already erased 15 months of gains and faces pressure from the lack of supportive legislation like the CLARITY Act. The broader market is feeling the impact, with Ethereum (ETH) plunging over 30% and other major altcoins like XRP and Cardano (ADA) suffering steep losses. The stalled progress on the CLARITY Act, following Coinbase's withdrawal of support, has further dampened sentiment. Stifel warns that a deeper retracement in Bitcoin could fuel widespread risk aversion across the cryptocurrency sector.

Key Points

  • Stifel predicts Bitcoin could drop to $38,000 based on historical bear market trends and Fed policy.
  • Bitcoin recently fell over 21%, erasing 15 months of gains, with a potential 70% pullback forecasted.
  • Legislative stalemate around the CLARITY Act and Coinbase's withdrawal of support are adding negative pressure.
  • Ethereum, XRP, and Cardano have all experienced significant price declines alongside Bitcoin.

Article

Bitcoin (BTC) price nosedived by over 21.3% in the past week to under $65,000 on Thursday, erasing 15 months of gains completely . However, the crypto could be at risk of a deeper downtrend, according to analysts at 116-year-old global wealth management firm Stifel. Bitcoin May Bottom Below $40,000 In a note to clients on Wednesday, Stifel analysts predicted that Bitcoin could drop as low as $38,000 in the coming months. With the premier cryptocurrency recently hovering around $64,836, according to CoinGecko, that would represent a 41% drop from Thursday’s prices. The analysts cited the extent to which Bitcoin has fallen from its all-time highs amid previous “super-bears”; the asset declined 93% in 2011, 84% in 2015, 83% in 2018, and 76% in 2022. Based on the ascending nature of those lows, Stifel estimated a 70% pullback this time around, while admitting that this represents their ugly bear case scenario. “Already down -41% from the high, Bitcoin super-bears have followed a linear trend suggesting a potential low of~$38K,” the team led by Barry B. Bannister wrote. Bitcoin hit an all-time high of $126,080 in October 2025 and has since plunged 48.1%, revisiting levels last seen in late 2024. Advertisement Stifel analysts also highlighted the significance of the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy outlook, suggesting that Bitcoin’s latest pullback was sparked by the hawkish tone of December’s rate cut. The analysts noted that if voting members of the Federal Open Markets Committee indicate no interest in fostering an inflationary boom amid an economic environment overcast by tariffs, then that could mark the Bitcoin bottom. Adding to the pain in the Bitcoin market, according to Stifel, is the CLARITY Act stalemate. After Coinbase abruptly withdrew support for the legislation, lawmakers have struggled to gain bipartisan support for the flagship crypto market structure bill. Moreover, momentum to pass the legislation has faded, as the Senate Banking Committee, which is vital to its passage, has not yet rescheduled a meeting to advance it. What Next? Meanwhile, Ethereum has fared even worse than Bitcoin, plunging over 30% in the past week and dropping to its lowest level since last May, currently trading around $1,899, according to crypto price aggregator CoinGecko. At the time of writing, XRP was trading at $1.30 after plummeting approximately 25.4% over the last seven days, while Cardano’s ADA is currently valued at $0.2525. A deeper Bitcoin retracement could fuel broader risk aversion in the crypto market.
